result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(1st) and OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(1st) and the other charge, OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bernard Haynes was found guilty of Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(1st), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Bernard Haynes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction; credit for 1 day served.

Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $350.00 PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges by 08-25-2016  or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 12 months.
Court ordered any vehicles owned/operated by the defendant to be equipped with the Ignition Interlock Device for 12 months.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf
- filed.

Defendant Bernard Haynes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury panel in court at 9:10 am.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Steven Grossmueller - Foxpoint Police Dept.  Court takes judicial notice that the intoxilyzer was in proper working order.  Exhibits  3-6 offered and received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 9:54 am.  Court had colloquy with the defendant about his right to/not to testify.  The defendant advised the Court that he would like to testify on his own behalf.  Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to remain silent.  Jury in box at 10:11 am.  Defense reserves his right to make any motions.  Sworn for defense:  Bernard Haynes.  Defense rests.  Sworn for State as rebuttal witness:  Sgt. Kyle Arendt - Foxpoint Police Dept.  Exhibit 7 offered and received.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 10:52 am.  Jury instruction conference held in chambers.  Jury in box at 11:06 am.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 12:05 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Haldemann who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Defense motion to dismiss at the close of the State's case is denied by the Court.  At the hour of 2:51 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3; GUILTY AS TO COUNT 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  State's motion for judgment on the verdict is granted.  Court denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court orders judgment of acquittal to COUNTS 1 AND 3.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, State's Witness List
Filed, State's Motion In Limine
Filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Bernard Haynes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury in box at 1:51 pm.  Jury selection continued.  Jury out of box at 2:30 pm.  In chambers discussion put on the record.  Jury in box at 2:46 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn at 2:46 pm.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Sgt. Kyle Arendt - Foxpoint Police Department. Exhibit 1 and 2 offered and received.  Case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 4.  Jury trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bernard Haynes in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
